title.native: ドルアーガの塔 〜the Aegis of URUK〜
title.romaji: Druaga no Tou: the Aegis of URUK
title.english: Tower of Druaga: The Aegis of Uruk

description:
It is said that every few years, there is what's known as the "Summer of Anu." During that summer, thanks to the divine protection of the sky-god Anu, all of the demons in the tower lose their power. The country of Uruk has begun an invasion of the tower in order to suppress the demons. They've built up positions inside the tower, with their sights set on getting to the upper levels. The Uruk army knows that this is the third Summer of Anu-a perfect time to launch a mission to suppress the monster Druaga once and for all. The army soldiers aren't the only ones in the tower, though. An enitre city called Meskia has formed inside the tower's first floor. It plays host not just to soldiers, but also to adventurers who have heard rumors about a legendary treasure called the Blue Crystal Rod, which is said to rest at the very top of the tower. With all these different groups in the mix, each with its own agenda, one can only guess how things will play out during this unusual summer.

(Source: Newtype Magazine)

tags.description: Features a character who isn't sexually attracted to people of any sex or gender.

tags.name: Succubus
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a succubus, a creature in medieval folklore that typically uses their sexual prowess to trap and seduce people to feed off them.

tags.description: Centers around the sport of basketball.

title.native: ドルアーガの塔 ～the Sword of URUK～

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/brinapalencia) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/brinakins/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/brina.palencia.7)

Brina Michelle Palencia is an American voice actress who has voiced a number of English-language versions of characters featured in anime. She's a graduate of University of North Texas. [Gino Palencia](https://anilist.co/staff/104093), her brother, also works for Funimation.

(Source: Wikipedia)

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

Started his career as an in-betweener for [Nakamura Production](https://anilist.co/studio/6658/Nakamura-Production) working on several outsourced episodes of [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/Sunrise) shows. 

He had his breakthrough as animator on [Yoroiden Samurai Troopers](https://anilist.co/anime/1264/) where his detailed art and animation attracted attention. He was thus selected to be character designer for the sequel, [Yoroiden Samurai Troopers Gaiden](https://anilist.co/anime/1265/), and later animation director for the [Mobile Suit Gundam F91](https://anilist.co/anime/88/) movie. 

Since then he's been heavily involved in Sunrise productions, both as animator and as character designer. Notable examples of his designs are those for [Mobile Suit Gundam Wing](https://anilist.co/anime/90/) and [Argento Soma](https://anilist.co/anime/285/).

He had his debut as a director with [Witch Hunter Robin](https://anilist.co/anime/7/), after which he directed the acclaimed [Ergo Proxy](https://anilist.co/anime/790/). More recent works of his include the adaptation of [Gangsta](https://anilist.co/anime/20773/), as well as the [Mobile Suit Gundam Hathaway](https://anilist.co/anime/105595/) trilogy.

__Notable works outside Anime:__

- Final Fantasy IX (Video Game, 2000) (Character Design)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jnordell)

He is known for his work on Sands of Destruction (2008), The Tower of DRUAGA: The Aegis of URUK (2008) and One Piece (1999).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cher_vOwO)

__Cher Watanabe__ is a Japanese musician, composer, arranger and keyboardist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cher_vOwO)

__Cher Watanabe__ is a Japanese musician, composer, arranger and keyboardist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/49378668) | [Fanbox (NSFW)](https://fujiishingo.fanbox.cc/posts/3033014)

Originating from [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/), where his peers included [Yoshimichi Kameda](https://anilist.co/staff/105635/) and [Shinichi Kurita](https://anilist.co/staff/137119/). He drew analogically for the first two years of his career and then switched to digital. [Yasushi Muraki](https://anilist.co/staff/105090/) calls him a follower of [Souichirou Matsuda](https://anilist.co/staff/141244/), whom Fujii is influenced by.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/162305754) | [Website](http://gatoh.com/)

Noted as the creator of the [Full Metal Panic!](https://anilist.co/manga/40892/) franchise.

Gatou first met [Kouichi Chigira](https://anilist.co/staff/106134/), the director of Full Metal Panic's first season, by accident when he bumped into him in Shinjuku when he was late for work. The two were surprised to later meet each other at [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/)'s offices.

He has also worked as a scriptwriter on a handful of [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/)'s shows after their involvement in adapting Full Metal Panic, most notably working as the lead writer on [Hyouka](https://anilist.co/anime/12189/). He also supervised the studio's production of [Amagi Brilliant Park](https://anilist.co/anime/20602/), which was adapted from another light novel of his.

In 2019, Gatou posted controversial remarks to his Twitter about teenage environmental activist Greta Thunberg, but later removed the tweet in response to public backlash and apologized for writing it.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/東潤一)

Founder and representative director of Studio Easter.
